rationale: Both 'tissue_id' and 'parent_sample_id' relate to sample identification in the assay context. However, 'tissue_id' is specific to tissue, while 'parent_sample_id' can cover various types of samples, so a close match is appropriate.
No matching field in the target schema directly corresponds to the assay execution date and time.
'protocols_io_doi' in the source schema and 'preparation_protocol_doi' in the target schema both refer to the DOI for protocols used in the assay. These fields are functionally identical.
The source schema includes 'operator', which refers to the individual responsible for the assay, but no corresponding field exists in the target schema.
The 'operator_email' field has no direct equivalent in the target schema.
'pi' refers to the principal investigator, but no matching field is available in the target schema.
'pi_email' has no corresponding field in the target schema.
'assay_type' and 'dataset_type' are both specifying the exact type of assay being performed. They map exactly.
Both fields are defined as 'analyte_class' in the source and target schemas, referring to the target molecules being measured in the assay.
Both the source and target fields describe whether the assay targets specific molecules, making this an exact match.
Both fields refer to the vendor of the acquisition instrument used in the assay, so they are an exact match.
Both fields refer to the specific model of the acquisition instrument, so this is an exact match.
No corresponding field for the pixel width ('resolution_x_value') exists in the target schema.
No matching field for the pixel width unit ('resolution_x_unit') is available in the target schema.
No corresponding field for the pixel height ('resolution_y_value') is present in the target schema.
No matching field for the pixel height unit ('resolution_y_unit') is available in the target schema.
'resolution_z_value' (z-pitch resolution) is not present in the target schema.
No corresponding field for 'resolution_z_unit' exists in the target schema.
'number_of_channels' (the number of channels capturing emission) has no direct equivalent in the target schema.
Both fields refer to the path to the file with ORCID IDs for contributors, making this an exact match.
Both fields describe the relative path to the dataset files, making this an exact match.
